info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 2:46AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hancock and southern McDonough Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 245 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Fandon, or 15 miles northwest of Rushville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Industry, Adair and Pennington Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
